item.title: Have you ever had a pumpkin pie milkshake?!
item.description: They’re my favorite twist on a thanksgiving classic. To a blender you add a few scoops of vanilla ice cream, a splash of milk, chunks of edwards desserts and blend it all up and top with whipped cream and cinnamon. Little bits of pumpkin pie will be all up in there

item.title: Thanksgiving planning is in effect!
item.description:
Thanksgiving planning is in effect! This chipotle-braised carrots side dish is SO tasty and was prepared in just 10 minutes! Topped with all the garnishes: onion, radishes, radishes, cilantro, lime crema, pepitas and cotija. Recipe is in the comments below!
#Thanksgiving #thanksgivingdinner #thanksgivingfood #recipe #recipeideas #recipesharing #deliciousfood

item.title: Baked mac'n'cheese
item.description: For Thanksgiving, we’re making everything BUT the turkey bc turkey is mid (we all know this) kicking things off with the most important dish on any thanksgiving table and that’s the baked mac n cheese here’s what i want in my mac n cheese: 1. saucey. i don’t want a dry baked mac n cheese. 2. flavor. this comes from using a variety of cheeses and spices like paprika, garlic powder and dijon mustard. we want dimensions of flavors. 3. a crust. a cheese crust on top is a must!

item.title: these sesame chocolate chip cookies are fire
item.description: These Sesame Chocolate Chip Cookies are so deliciously savory and sweet. This recipe utilizes toasted sesame seed oil and sesame seeds for lovely flavor.

item.title: Grinder pasta salad
item.description: Like the cuter, hotter cousin to the grinder sandwich.

item.title: vanilla butterscotch upside down cake
item.description: here’s the full recipe for this delicious apple cake. 4 tablespoons unsalted butter 1/2 cup light brown sugar 3 honey crisp apples, peeled, cored, and cut into 1/2-inch wedges 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder 1 teaspoon kosher salt 1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter, melted 1 cup granulated sugar 2 large eggs, beaten 1/2 cup milk 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract Glaze 1/4 cup powdered sugar 2 teaspoons milk 1. Line and grease a 9-inch pan. I like to line the bottom with a round of parchment. 2. In a small saucepan, set over medium heat, add the butter. When melted, pour in the brown sugar. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes, until all caramelized together. 3. Pour the butterscotch in the 9-inch pan. Arrange the apples on top of the butterscotch. 4. In a medium bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, baking powder and salt. 5. Whisk together the melted butter, sugar, eggs and milk until smooth. 6. Pour the batter atop the apples and smooth it out. Transfer to the oven to bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean. 7. Allow to cool in the pan for 10 to 15 minutes. Meanwhile, make the glaze by whisking together the milk and powdered sugar. Run a knife around the edge of the cake and place a serving plate on top. Turn the cake onto the plate. Drizzle with the icing.

item.title: creamy vodka pasta
item.description: truly the best weeknight meal that is *almost* a pantry meal

item.title: Thanksgiving series: Homemade Apple pie
item.description: 1. use a simple combo of different apples, I like using braeburn, honey crisp and 1 granny smith. this adds some different apple flavors 2. brown sugar adds a really nice molasses-y hint of flavor 3. all-purpose flour vs. cornstarch is great because apples aren’t as juicy as berries so they don’t need it. 4. I love adding creme fraiche or sour cream. as it bakes, it makes a caramel-like sauce and it’s DELICIOUS. 5. bake it until it’s bubbly and the crust is visibly golden brown. we don’t like underbaked pies. 6. use a metal pie pan. i used to be a glass pie pan girl and i have long since changed my tune. they bake faster and are much easier to stick in the freezer if need be!

item.title: Thanksgiving series: French Onion Rolls
item.description: They are amazing, These are filled with caramelized onions and delicious melty gruyere cheese.

item.title: Homemade cranberry sauce
item.description: My favorite part of thanksgiving. Here's the recipe: 1 (12-ounce) bag cranberries 1/4 cup white sugar 1/4 cup brown sugar 1 cinnamon stick 1/4 tsp kosher salt 1 tsp vanilla 1 tsp orange zest 1/2 tsp grated fresh ginger 1/2 cup water Juice from 1 orange

item.title: Jalapeño Cheddar Cornbread
item.description: The perfect combination of a teeny bit sweet and spicy and cheesy. The best combination. It’s so delicious when served piping hot with scallion butter.

item.title: Weekend baking vibes: easy apple cheese danish
item.description: A simple, cozy recipe that blends flaky pastry, creamy cheese, and warm apple filling, perfect for effortless weekend baking.
